00001 ######################################################################
00002 ##
00003 ##  Functions for creating tables of various kinds
00004 ##
00005 ##    ColumnTable()           Creates a two-column display in HTML,
00006 ##                            but only one column in TeX.
00007 ##
00008 ##    ColumnMatchTable()      Does a side-by-side match table
00009 ##
00010 ##    BeginTable()            Begin a borderless HTML table
00011 ##    Row()                   Create a row in the table
00012 ##    AlignedRow()            Create a row with alignment in each column
00013 ##    TableSpace()            Insert extra vertical space in the table
00014 ##    EndTable()              End the table
00015 ##
00016 
00017 ######################################################################
00018 #
00019 #  Make a two-column table in HTML and Latex2HTML modes
00020 #
00021 #  Usage:  ColumnTable(col1,col2,[options])
00022 #
00023 #  Options can be taken from:
00024 #
00025 #      indent => n           the width to indent the first column
00026 #                            (default is 0)
00027 #
00028 #      separation => n       the width of the separating gutter
00029 #                            (default is 50)
00030 #
00031 #      valign => type        set the vertical alignment
00032 #                            (default is "MIDDLE")
00033 #
00034 sub ColumnTable {
00035   my $col1 = shift; my $col2 = shift;
00036   my %options = (indent => 0, separation => 50, valign => "MIDDLE", @_);
00037   my ($ind,$sep) = ($options{"indent"},$options{"separation"});
00038   my $valign = $options{"valign"};
00039 
00040   my ($bhtml,$ehtml) = ('\begin{rawhtml}','\end{rawhtml}');
00041   ($bhtml,$ehtml) = ('','') unless ($displayMode eq "Latex2HTML");
00042 
00043   my $HTMLtable = qq {
00044     $bhtml<TABLE BORDER="0"><TR VALIGN="$valign">
00045     <TD WIDTH="$ind">&nbsp;</TD><TD>$ehtml
00046     $col1
00047     $bhtml</TD><TD WIDTH="$sep">&nbsp;</TD><TD>$ehtml
00048     $col2
00049     $bhtml</TD></TR></TABLE>$ehtml
00050   };
00051 
00052   MODES(
00053     TeX => '\par\medskip\hbox{\qquad\vtop{'.
00054        '\advance\hsize by -3em '.$col1.'}}'.
00055            '\medskip\hbox{\qquad\vtop{'.
00056            '\advance\hsize by -3em '.$col2.'}}\medskip',
00057     Latex2HTML => $HTMLtable,
00058     HTML => $HTMLtable
00059   );
00060 }
00061 
00062 #
00063 #  Use columns for a match-list output
00064 #
00065 #  Usage:  ColumnMatchTable($ml,options)
00066 #
00067 #  where $ml is a math list reference and options are those
00068 #  allowed for ColumnTable above.
00069 #
00070 sub ColumnMatchTable {
00071   my $ml = shift;
00072 
00073   ColumnTable($ml->print_q,$ml->print_a,@_);
00074 }

00076 
00077 #
00078 #  Command for tables with no borders.
00079 #
00080 #  Usage:  BeginTable(options);
00081 #
00082 #  Options are taken from:
00083 #
00084 #    border => n           value for BORDER attribute (default 0)
00085 #    spacing => n          value for CELLSPACING attribute (default 0)
00086 #    padding => n          value for CELLPADDING attribute (default 0)
00087 #    tex_spacing => dimen  value for spacing between columns in TeX
00088 #                          (e.g, tex_spacing => 2em) (default 1em)
00089 #    tex_border => dimen   value for left- and right border in TeX (0pt)
00090 #    center => 0 or 1      center table or not (default 1)
00091 #
00092 sub BeginTable {
00093   my %options = (border => 0, padding => 0, spacing => 0, center => 1,
00094                  tex_spacing => "1em", tex_border => "0pt", @_);
00095   my ($bd,$pd,$sp) = ($options{border},$options{padding},$options{spacing});
00096   my ($tsp,$tbd) = ($options{tex_spacing},$options{tex_border});
00097   my ($center,$tcenter) = (' ALIGN="CENTER"','\centerline');
00098      ($center,$tcenter) = ('','') if (!$options{center});
00099   my $table = 
00100     qq{<TABLE BORDER="$bd" CELLPADDING="$pd" CELLSPACING="$sp"$center>};
00101 
00102   MODES(
00103     TeX => '\par\medskip'.$tcenter.'{\kern '.$tbd.
00104            '\vbox{\halign{#\hfil&&\kern '.$tsp.' #\hfil',
00105     Latex2HTML => $bHTML.$table.$eHTML."\n",
00106     HTML => $table."\n"
00107   );
00108 }
00109 
00110 #
00111 #  Usage:  EndTable(options)
00112 #
00113 #  where options are taken from:
00114 #
00115 #     tex_border => dimen     extra vertical space in TeX mode (default 0pt)
00116 #
00117 sub EndTable {
00118   my %options = (tex_border => "0pt", @_);
00119   my $tbd = $options{tex_border};
00120   MODES(
00121     TeX => '\cr}}\kern '.$tbd.'}\medskip'."\n",
00122     Latex2HTML => $bHTML.'</TABLE>'.$eHTML."\n",
00123     HTML => '</TABLE>'."\n"
00124   );
00125 }
00126 
00127 #
00128 #  Creates a row in the table
00129 #
00130 #  Usage:  Row([item1,item2,...],options);
00131 #
00132 #  Each item appears as a separate entry in the table.
00133 #
00134 #  Options control how the row is displayed:
00135 #
00136 #    indent => num           Specifies size of blank column on the left
00137 #                            (default:  indent => 0)
00138 #
00139 #    separation => num       Specifies separation of columns
00140 #                            (default:  spearation => 30)
00141 #
00142 #    align => "type"         Specifies alignment of initial column
00143 #                            (default:  align => "LEFT")
00144 #
00145 #    valign => "type"        Specified vertical alignment of row
00146 #                            (default:  valign => "MIDDLE")
00147 #
00148 sub Row {
00149   my $rowref = shift; my @row = @{$rowref};
00150   my %options = (
00151      indent => 0, separation => 30,
00152      align => "LEFT", valign => "MIDDLE",
00153      @_
00154   );
00155   my ($cind,$csep) = ($options{indent},$options{separation});
00156   my ($align,$valign) = ($options{align},$options{valign});
00157   my $sep = '<TD WIDTH="'.$csep.'">&nbsp;</TD>'; $sep = '' if ($csep < 1);
00158   my $ind = '<TD WIDTH="'.$cind.'">&nbsp;</TD>'; $ind = '' if ($cind < 1);
00159   my $fill = '';
00160   $fill = '\hfil' if (uc($align) eq "CENTER");
00161   $fill = '\hfill' if (uc($align) eq "RIGHT");
00162 
00163   MODES(
00164     TeX => "\\cr\n". $fill . join('& ',@row),
00165     Latex2HTML =>
00166       $bHTML."<TR VALIGN=\"$valign\">$ind<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">".$eHTML .
00167       join($bHTML."</TD>$sep<TD>".$eHTML,@row) .
00168       $bHTML.'</TD></TR>'.$eHTML."\n",
00169     HTML => "<TR VALIGN=\"$valign\">$ind<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">" .
00170       join("</TD>$sep<TD>",@row) . '</TD></TR>'."\n"
00171   );
00172 }
00173 
00174 #
00175 #  AlignedRow([item1,item2,...],options);
00176 #
00177 #  Options control how the row is displayed:
00178 #
00179 #    indent => num           Specifies size of blank column on the left
00180 #                            (default:  indent => 0)
00181 #
00182 #    separation => num       Specifies separation of columns
00183 #                            (default:  spearation => 30)
00184 #
00185 #    align => "type"         Specifies alignment of all columns
00186 #                            (default:  align => "CENTER")
00187 #
00188 #    valign => "type"        Specified vertical alignment of row
00189 #                            (default:  valign => "MIDDLE")
00190 #
00191 sub AlignedRow {
00192   my $rowref = shift; my @row = @{$rowref};
00193   my %options = (
00194      indent => 0, separation => 30,
00195      align => "CENTER", valign => "MIDDLE",
00196      @_
00197   );
00198   my ($cind,$csep) = ($options{indent},$options{separation});
00199   my ($align,$valign) = ($options{align},$options{valign});
00200   my $sep = '<TD WIDTH="'.$csep.'">&nbsp;</TD>'; $sep = '' if ($csep < 1);
00201   my $ind = '<TD WIDTH="'.$cind.'">&nbsp;</TD>'; $ind = '' if ($cind < 1);
00202   my $fill = '';
00203   $fill = '\hfil ' if (uc($align) eq "CENTER");
00204   $fill = '\hfill ' if (uc($align) eq "RIGHT");
00205 
00206   MODES(
00207     TeX => "\\cr\n". $fill . join('&'.$fill,@row),
00208     Latex2HTML =>
00209       $bHTML."<TR VALIGN=\"$valign\">$ind<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">".$eHTML .
00210       join($bHTML."</TD>$sep<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">".$eHTML,@row) .
00211       $bHTML.'</TD></TR>'.$eHTML."\n",
00212     HTML => "<TR VALIGN=\"$valign\">$ind<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">" .
00213       join("</TD>$sep<TD ALIGN=\"$align\">",@row) . '</TD></TR>'."\n"
00214   );
00215 }
00216 
00217 #
00218 #  Add extra space between rows of a table
00219 #
00220 #  Usage:  TableSpace(pixels,points)
00221 #
00222 #  where pixels is the number of pixels of space in HTML mode and
00223 #  points is the number of points to use in TeX mode.
00224 #
00225 sub TableSpace {
00226   my $rsep = shift;
00227   my $tsep = shift;
00228   $rsep = $tsep if (defined($tsep) && $main::displayMode eq "TeX");
00229   return "" if ($rsep < 1);
00230   MODES(
00231     TeX => '\vadjust{\kern '.$rsep.'pt}' . "\n",
00232     Latex2HTML =>
00233       $bHTML.'<TR><TD HEIGHT="'.$rsep.'"><!></TD></TR>'.$eHTML."\n",
00234     HTML => '<TR><TD HEIGHT="'.$rsep.'"></TD></TR>'."\n",
00235   );
00236 }
00237 
00238 #
00239 #  A horizontal rule within a table.  (Could have been a variable,
00240 #  but all the other table commands are subroutines, so kept it
00241 #  one to be consistent.)
00242 #
00243 sub TableLine {
00244   MODES(
00245     TeX => '\vadjust{\kern2pt\hrule\kern2pt}',
00246     Latex2HTML => $bHTML.
00247       '<TR><TD COLSPAN="10"><HR NOSHADE SIZE="1"></TD></TR>'.
00248       $eHTML."\n",
00249     HTML =>'<TR><TD COLSPAN="10"><HR NOSHADE SIZE="1"></TD></TR>'."\n"
00250   );
00251 }
